## Background
<img src="zimgs/Walleye.jpg" alt="Walleye" class="img-right">
Managers of a large chain of supermarkets in Japan recorded specific information about individual sales in three of their stores. Their [data are in this file](https://derekogle.com/NCGraphing/modules/Intro/supermarket_sales.csv) (with [metadata under "columns" at this site](https://www.kaggle.com/aungpyaeap/supermarket-sales/data). Before loading these data, load the `tidyverse` package, which will load `ggplot2` along with a few other packages you will need to access these data.

```{r echo=TRUE, results="hide"}
library(tidyverse)
```

Their data are loaded below and, for this exercise, reduced to only "Food and beverages" sales.

```{r echo=TRUE, results='hide'}
avoc <- read.csv("https://derekogle.com/NCGraphing/modules/Intro/avocados.csv",
                stringsAsFactors=FALSE) %>%
  filter(region=="GreatLakes") %>%
  mutate(type=factor(type))
```

&nbsp;

## Example 1
Construct `ggplot2` code to match the graph below (as closely as you can).

```{r avoc1}
avoc1 <- ggplot(data=avoc,
                mapping=aes(x=AveragePrice,y=Total.Bags,
                            color=type)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  scale_x_continuous(name="Average Price of Avocados ($)") +
  scale_y_continuous(name="Total Number of Bags Sold") +
  theme_bw()
avoc1
```

&nbsp;


## Example 2
Construct `ggplot2` code to match the graph below (as closely as you can).

```{r avoc2}
avoc2 <- ggplot(data=avoc,
                mapping=aes(x=Date,y=AveragePrice,
                            color=type)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  scale_x_continuous(name="Average Price of Avocados ($)") +
  scale_y_continuous(name="Total Number of Bags Sold") +
  theme_bw()
avoc2
```
